Bozzuto's, Inc.

400 Industrial Avenue

Cheshire, CT 06410



REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED / QUANTITY



Anhydrous Ammonia

39,948 lbs.



INTRODUCTION



Bozzuto's, Inc. is a wholesale food distributor based in the Cheshire community for over fifty years. In

August of 1995, Bozzuto's completed construction of a state of the art warehouse distribution center. Among

its advantages, this distribution center utilizes the benefits of ammonia as a refrigerant. Bozzuto's does

recognize ammonia as a hazardous chemical, and this was a consideration when selecting the

refrigerant for the facility. In consideration of the risks associated with the use of ammonia, Bozzuto's

commits its efforts to ensuring the employees and surrounding community continue to enjoy a healthy and

safe environment.

Part of this commitment includes:

- Employing only skilled refrigeration technicians;

- Contracting with only experienced ammonia refrigeration contractors;

- Coordination with the Cheshire Fire Department;

- Partnering with a hazardous materials release contractor; and

- Maintaining communication with the Cheshire Town Manager, the designated Local Emergency Planning

Commission (LEPC).



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION



Accidental release prevention is the approach Bozzuto's has taken to minimize and possibly eliminate the

potential for an accidental release. Bozzuto's exercises ongoing preventive maintenance and equipment

integrity procedures. Some of these programs include:

- Process Safety Management / Risk Management,

- Hazard Communication, and

- Lockout / Tagout.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Bozzuto's maintains twenty-four hour, seven day per week coverage of trained Security Officers. If the event of an emergency the notifier will dial an emergency extension and be connected to a Security Officer. The Security Officer will gather the information and initiate the Emergency Response Plan.

Having this continuous coverage reduces the response time in an emerg

ency condition, thereby minimizing

the consequences.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



Bozzuto's views the risk of accidental release very seriously. Accidental release prevention programs include:

- Process Safety Management / Risk Management,

- Hazard Communication, and

- Lockout / Tagout.



Through a Process Hazard Analysis, Bozzuto's uses a hazard and operability study to identify potential

accidental release conditions. Solutions are then developed to prevent or limit these conditions from

happening.



If an incident were to happen, an investigation would take place, and new procedures would be implemented

so a similar occurrence could be prevented.



Bozzuto's prevention programs are audited at regular intervals to validate their effectiveness; the

objective is to be proactive in preventing accidental releases, not reactive.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no significant releases of ammonia that exceeded the Federal reportable Quantity of 100 pounds or the state requirement mandating immediate reporting of any release or threatened release of a hazardous material in the past five years.  In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from an ammonia release, nor any releases or "near misses" that warranted an internal incident investigation.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



The Bozzuto's facility has an emergency action plan in effect. The Emergency Action Plan (EAP) is

detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of PSM/RMP document. This Plan was designed to

meet the following objectives:

1.) To save lives.

2.) To minimize and avoid injuries.

3.) To protect the environment.

4.) To minimize property damage.



The EAP provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health

hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency

situations that may arise at the facility. This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per

year. This Plan

was reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM/RMP regulations.



In case of an ammonia emergency, the facility will evacuate all employees in the facility. The trained

emergency responders in association with the local emergency responders (Chesire Fire Department) will

respond to any releases at the facility. The Bozzuto's facility coordinates emergency response efforts with the

fire department on a periodic and ongoing basis.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Bozzuto's is continually looking for new ways of improving the safety level of its employees and community.  Bozzuto's continues to work with an experienced hazardous materials spill contractor. The intention of the partnership is to provide Bozzuto's additional specific expertise in the field of hazardous materials release procedures and prevention. Continuing discussions and exercises are planned to ensure an efficient and

prompt response time.



The Process Hazard Analysis generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the Bozzuto's Facility. The mitigation measures include additional training, key maintenance related tests/inspection, and enhanced emergency response policies and procedures.  Bozzuto's is planning to

complete several items, including the recommendations, over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:

1. Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety Plan/Programs.

2. Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.

3. Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.

4. Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.
